description: Indonesia holds 3.5 million hectares of mangroves, about 23% of the worldâ€™s total, and is the most diverse with 92 true mangrove species. The Coordinating Ministry for Maritime Affairs and Investment (CMMAI) is mandated to coordinate the related ministries and agencies, including Ministry of Marine Affairs and Fisheries, Ministry of Environment and Forestry, and the Mangrove and Peatland Restoration Agency to support mangroves rehabilitation across provinces in Indonesia.
name: Mangrove
